data.fullContent: Prior to the launch of the console in November 1993, Atari had announced a variety of peripherals and add-ons for the Jaguar to be released over the console's lifespan. This included a CD-ROM-based add-on console, a dial-up internet link with support for online gaming, a virtual reality headset, and an MPEG-2 video card. However, due to the poor sales and eventual commercial failure of the Jaguar, most of the peripherals in development were scrapped. The only peripherals and add-ons released by Atari for the Jaguar were a redesigned controller, an adapter for four-players, a CD console add-on and a link cable for Local area network (LAN) gaming.
data.answer: 在1993年11月推出控制台之前，雅达利宣布了一系列的外围设备和附加组件，捷豹将在控制台的寿命期间发布。这包括一个基于cd - rom的附加控制台、一个支持在线游戏的拨号互联网连接、一个虚拟现实头戴式设备和一个MPEG-2显卡。然而，由于糟糕的销售和最终的商业失败的捷豹，大多数外围设备的发展被废弃。雅达利为Jaguar发布的唯一外接设备和附加组件是重新设计的控制器，一个四人适配器，一个CD控制台附加组件和一个用于局域网游戏的连接电缆。
